intro: Chiococca oaxacana, commonly known as the Oaxaca chiococca, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
